column2: Autosize is a small, stand-alone script to automatically adjust textarea height to fit text.

Added options object for indicating if the script should set the overflowX and overflowY.  The default behavior lets the script control the overflows, which will normalize the appearance between browsers.  Fixes #220.

v3.0.0 - renamed events and added new methods.

Renamed custom events as to not use jQuery's custom events namespace:

autosize.resized renamed to autosize:resized
autosize.update renamed to autosize:update
autosize.destroy renamed to autosize:destroy
converted to ES6 and made the update and destroy methods more flexible.
updated build script to use babel
cleanup.  removed lines that set wordWrap and overflow style property values, as these are no longer needed as of v2.0.

smaller, simplier code-base
new API.  Example usage:

Explicitly set the padding of the textarea to 0

Merge pull request #103 from nickbaum/master

Explicitly set the padding of the textarea to 0

Explicitly set the padding of the textarea to 0

If textareas are styled to have a width of 100%, as well as a non-zero padding, the "invisible" textarea inserted by autosize.js will increase the width of the page by the amount of the padding, resulting in a horizontal scrollbar.

This may seem like an edge case, but the popular CSS framework Foundation sets those properties by default as part of their form styling.

The fix is to explicitly set the padding of the invisible textarea to 0. I have tested this on my site and it solves the issue without affecting autosize's functionality.
Fixed a potential issue introduced in 1.17.4 that causes an 'NS_ERROR_FAILURE' error in Firefox (fixes #100).

passing contributor commit through build step.

Make anonymous. Remove all windows "return" characters.

	$('textarea.example').trigger('autosize.destroy');
Minor optimization
Documented the autosize.textareaSizeChanged event in the changelog.
Autosize will now reconstruct the mirror in response to an "autosize.textareaStyleChanged" event.
Fixed a compatability issue with jQuery versions before 1.9 introduced in the previous update (Fixes #82)

IE8: ensures that the initial height is used if min-height is not set
better horizontal scroll patch
Prevents horizontal scroll

textarea passed in as parameter as well as 'this' element

This makes it easier to work with TypeScript's 'this' in lambdas;

i.e. callback: ta => this.doSomething(ta) //'this' from callback is lost

This may also be an issue with ECMAScript 6 lambdas. This shouldn't be a breaking change, it's just adding a parameter where there wasn't one previously.

Update jquery.autosize.js

on IE8 when textarea has display:none causes error:  Invalid argument. 
jquery.autosize.js, line 116 character 6

the width() returned by jQuery is a negative number, assigning it in IE8
causes the error.
Added the support of min-height on the textarea
Don't allow horizontal resize if original css was set to vertical
Cleanup

Update jquery.autosize.js

Changed maxHeight check to recalculate maxHeight when adjust is called, to account for cases where the maxHeight might have changed (e.g. auto-expand textbox on focus, auto-contract on blur)
make it work with Zepto, too

Added option to define an on-autosize callback

Changed single argument to an 'options' object while retaining backwards compatibility with existing $.autosize(className) code.
Added 'textIndent' to the list of styles considered for size detection.
